context.arch.storage
Class Attributes

java.lang.Object
  java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Attribute<?>>
          context.arch.storage.Attributes
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap<java.lang.String,Attribute<?>>, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Attribute<?>>
public class Attributes
extends java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap<java.lang.String,Attribute<?>>

This class is a container for a group of related attributes. Attributes can be added, removed, and found in the container. key = attribute name, value = attribute TODO: make type safe by either supporting Attribute or AttributeNameValue, but not both in a single Vector?

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

fromDataObject

public static Attributes fromDataObject(DataObject data)
Constructor that takes a DataObject as a parameter. The DataObject is expected to contain an tag. The constructor stores the encoded data in an Attributes object.

Parameters:
data - DataObject that contains the attribute name (and possibly type) info

toDataObject

public DataObject toDataObject()
Converts to a DataObject.

Returns:
Attributes object converted to an DataObject

add

public Attribute<?> add(Attribute<?> att)
Add an attribute, but may replace an old one if there existed one with the same name.

Parameters:
the - attribute to add
Returns:
the replaced attribute

containsName

public boolean containsName(java.lang.String attributeName)
Checks whether this contains an Attribute with a specific name.

Parameters:
attributeName - the name to find an Attribute with
Returns:
true if there exists an Attribute with name.equals(attributeName)

getSubset

public Attributes getSubset(Attributes filterAtts)
This method takes an Attributes containing the list of attributes (names) wanted and it filters all the rest out from this Attributes object.

Parameters:
atts - Attributes object containing the attributes to return
Returns:
filtered Attributes object

getAttributeValue

public <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> T getAttributeValue(java.lang.String attName)

compare

public <T extends java.lang.Comparable<? super T>> Attributes compare(Attributes other)
Compare this Attributes with another. It only checks for each Attribute in this (i.e. via their name), and compares with the value in other. This is an asymmetric comparison; be careful the proper direction to use it.

Parameters:
other -
Returns:
Attributes containing any Attribute in other that is different in value in this; the value assigned is that belonging to the original collection in this.
